resources.string: "USB charging not supported. Use only the supplied charger."
Allow the app %1$s to access the USB device?
Allow the app %1$s to access the USB accessory?
Open %1$s when this USB device is connected?
Open %1$s when this USB accessory is connected?
No installed apps work with this USB accessory. Learn more about this accessory at %1$s
Use by default for this USB device
Use by default for this USB accessory
"Network connection may be delayed or unstable because of data transfer via USB3.0"
When an app was designed for a smaller screen, a zoom control will appear by the clock.
"Couldn't save screenshot. Storage may be in use"
"Couldn't save screenshot. Content is protected by DRM"
Install Android File Transfer app for Mac

"You've reached the specified data usage limit.
If you re-enable data, you may be charged by the operator."
Connecting via packet data may incur additional charges. Continue?
Tap here to turn notifications back on.
Screen is locked in landscape orientation.
Screen is locked in portrait orientation.
"Access them anytime by swiping down. Swipe down again for system controls."
Air gesture and TalkBack cannot both be enabled. TalkBack will be disabled.
Air view and the options below cannot both be enabled. The options below will be disabled.
Multi window and TalkBack cannot both be enabled. TalkBack will be disabled.
Smart pause and TalkBack cannot both be enabled. TalkBack will be disabled.
Smart scroll and TalkBack cannot both be enabled. TalkBack will be disabled.
Smart stay and TalkBack cannot both be enabled. TalkBack will be disabled.
TalkBack and Toolbox cannot both be enabled at the same time. TalkBack will be disabled

"Smart network helps to conserve battery life.
It disables mobile data and Wi-Fi when the screen is turned off, so that the device consumes less battery.
However, you may receive cumulative push data when you turn on the screen."
Allow data roaming? You may incur significant roaming charges!
Data network allowed. When using data calls, you will incur additional charges according to your data call plan.
You will no longer be able to use applications such as Internet, Email and YouTube via mobile networks. Continue?
Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection.
Turn off the mobile data connection?

"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be disabled."
Mobile data connection is currently disabled. You need to connect Mobile data to use data applications such as Browser, Email and YouTube via mobile network. Do you want to make the connection?
Unable to connect to mobile networks while Flight mode is enabled. Disable Flight mode and try again
Unable to connect to mobile networks while network restriction mode is enabled. Disable network restriction mode and try again
Unable to connect to Wi-Fi while network restriction mode is enabled. Disable network restriction mode and try again
When this mode is enabled, notifications for selected features will be disabled. You will only receive notifications of incoming calls from people on your allowed list.

Blocking mode disables notifications for selected features. When incoming calls are blocked, you will only receive notifications of incoming calls from people on your allowed contacts. To change your Blocking mode settings, go to Settings > Personalisation > Blocking mode.
When this mode is enabled, notifications for the selected features will be disabled
To enable blocking mode, enable at least one function

Hands-free mode must be turned off in Settings after you have closed S Voice Hands-free. If Hands-free mode remains turned on, notifications and incoming call info will still be read out automatically.
"You can turn off Hands-free mode by saying 'Turn off Hands-free mode'in S Voice Hands-free, or by going to Settings or the notification panel"
Insert SIM card to access network services
Turning on Wi-Fi will disable Portable Wi-Fi hotspot. Continue?
To enable Power saving mode, enable at least one function
To turn on Hands-free mode, enable at least one relevant function
In network restriction mode, you can use all your applications without connecting to the network. You can also receive calls and SMS messages. Network restriction mode will be enabled.
Network restriction mode will be disabled
Unable to charge your device. Make sure you are using a Samsung compatible battery and charger and that your device is properly connected to the charger.
Charging paused. Battery temperature too high.
Charging paused. Battery temperature too low.

"The device has stopped charging. The battery temperature is too high. Be careful when disconnecting the charger. It may be very hot.
Disconnecting and reconnecting the charger may allow charging to continue normally. If overheating persists, contact customer services as there may be a risk of fire or injury."
Connect to a plug socket to charge device and close unused applications in Task Manager. Continued usage while charging may prevent efficient charging.
Exit unused applications in Task Manager. Continued usage while charging may prevent efficient charging.
If the battery drops below %d%% then you will be unable to open Camera
Unable to open Camera. Battery power is %d%% or less.
Press and hold the power key to turn on or off the Long life mode.
Wait until it has cooled down before using your device
You have placed the device within range. Now charging wirelessly...
Switching from wireless charging to cable charging
Switching from cable charging to wireless charging
Your device is now charging wirelessly. The S Pen will not work within range of wireless charger.

The connected charger is incompatible with this phone. To prevent damage to your phone, charging has been stopped. To continue charging, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this phone.

The connected charger is incompatible with this tablet. To prevent damage to your tablet, charging has been stopped. To continue charging, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.
Unable to charge. Use the original charger.
The connected charger will take longer to charge. To charge faster, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this phone.
The connected charger will take longer to charge or may not charge at all. To charge faster, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.
To charge faster, use the original charger
To charge faster, use the charger and cable that were provided with this phone
To charge faster, use the charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.
For protection against water damage, firmly seal the charging cover before use.
Your phone is getting too hot. It will now turn off to cool down.
Your tablet is getting too hot. It will now turn off to cool down.
Why did my phone turn off by itself?
Why did my tablet turn off by itself?

"Your phone got too hot. It turned off to prevent damage to the phone.
Overheating can be caused by: Using graphics intensive apps like video games and navigation apps for long periods of time. Downloading or uploading large files. Using your phone in a very hot location."

"Your tablet got too hot. It turned off to prevent damage to the tablet.
Overheating can be caused by: Using graphics intensive apps like video games and navigation apps for long periods of time. Downloading or uploading large files. Using your tablet in a very hot location."
Your device is overheating. It will now power off to cool down.

"Your device overheated. It powered off to prevent damage.
Overheating can be caused by: Using graphics-intensive applications, such as games and navigation applications, for long periods of time. Transferring large files. Using your device in a hot environment."
Your battery power is lower than the power sharing limit. To continue sharing power, adjust the power sharing limit to below the current battery power level.
Power sharing has ended. Disconnect the cable.
Smart stay cannot detect your eyes
Device storage is full. Delete some items
After you put your device down, the screen will turn off.
Suppose you have missed calls or messages. Put down your device, then pick it up again when the screen has turned off.
Unable to start Camera during call
You have access to China Telecom WLAN network, consult 10000 to understand billing information, please turn off when not use

By selecting this setting, you are allowing access to all location information by any third party through web access or any software or peripheral components you chose to install, download, add/or attach to the device or any other means. Enabling this functionality could pose certain risks to users of this device. Data usage will apply.

"Your phone can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping and weather.
Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you are considering to understand how they collect, use and share your location information before you use them.
Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply."

"Your tablet can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping and weather.
Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you’re considering to understand how they collect, use and share your location information before you use them.
Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply."
Enabling portable Wi-Fi hotspot will turn off Wi-Fi
To enable air view, enable at least one function
To enable Air view, enable at least one function from the selected Air view mode
To enable air gesture, enable at least one function
Tap and hold a quick setting button to go to the relevant settings
THIS HANDSET CAN DETECT YOUR LOCATION

"If you turn location \"ON\" and activate a third party location based service on this handset, you consent to U.S. Cellular's use of and disclosure to such third party of this handset's location. Turning location \"ON\" will allow U.S. Cellular to track the location of this handset and share such information with third party providers of location-based services. Once this handset's location information is transferred from U.S. Cellular to the third-party location-based service provider, that third party's privacy policy will govern subsequent uses of your location information. You should carefully review the terms and conditions and associated privacy policy of each such location- based service for information regarding how the third party provider of that service will use, disclose, protect and retain your location information. Such uses may include, but not be limited to, offering you location-based promotions and sharing your location with others. U.S. Cellular uses a variety of commercially reasonable and appropriate safeguards to protect location information residing on our systems from unauthorized access or disclosure including, without limitation, server firewalls and physical facility security. We also restrict access to location information to only those work groups that need to know that information for their job function. No security is perfect, however, and U.S. Cellular cannot guarantee the security of your location information. U.S. Cellular does not guaranty the accuracy or completeness of location information delivered through its network, and any location-based service may be disrupted or fail due to environmental factors and factors affecting satellite usage. You should understand the risks involved in consenting to the disclosure of your handset's location information before requesting a location based service and inform users to whom you provide your handset that his or her location can be tracked. Turning location \"OFF\" will hide the location of this handset from everyone except U.S. Cellular, the entities to which U.S. Cellular may disclose your location information as permitted by law, including but not limited to public safety, fire service or law enforcement officials in emergency situations, and third party providers of location-based services that track the location of this handset without U.S. Cellular's cooperation. "
You consent to disclosure of the location of this handset from U.S. Cellular to third-party providers of location-based services by turning location \"ON\"
Reading mode has been enabled. The screen is now optimised for reading. This mode is only available in selected applications
Automatic brightness settings are applied to the inner screen only
Brightness adjusted manually. Auto brightness disabled.
Flight mode allows you to turn off network features, including Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. To use Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, turn them on in Settings or the notification panel.
Airplane mode turns off calling, messaging, and mobile network functions.
Use one finger to pull down the status bar from the top of the screen.
Use two fingers to pull down the status bar from the top of the screen.
The quick setting panel is displayed.
Use two fingers to pull down one of the lists from the notification panel.
More information about the selected list is displayed.

Download large files (over %d MB) faster using Wi-Fi and LTE networks at the same time. Note that depending on the statuses of networks, Download booster may use only Wi-Fi or LTE networks to download files.

Download large files (over %d MB) faster using Wi-Fi and LTE networks at the same time. Note that depending on the statuses of networks, Download booster may use only Wi-Fi or LTE networks to download files.
Download booster will be enabled. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Wi-Fi is currently turned off. To enable Download booster, both Wi-Fi and Mobile data must be turned on. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Mobile data is currently turned off. To enable Download booster, both Wi-Fi and Mobile data must be turned on. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Wi-Fi and Mobile data are currently turned off. To enable Download booster, both Wi-Fi and Mobile data must be turned on. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Unable to use Download booster while roaming. We recommend downloading via a Wi-Fi network.
Turn on Wi-Fi and Mobile data
Unable to use Download booster while %1$s is enabled. Disable %2$s and try again.
Unable to connect to mobile networks while Flight mode is enabled. Disable Flight mode and try again.
Portable Wi-Fi hotspot consumes much battery power and increases your data usage. Continue?
Turning off Airplane mode will end your USB 3.0 connection and stop any ongoing data transfers.

"Your device is overheating. Steps will be taken to cool it down.
You can still use your device, but - the screen may get dimmer. - the device may slow down. - charging may pause.
Closing the current app will help cool down your device.
After the device cools down, performance will return to normal automatically."
Unable to open applications. You can only use the Phone and Contacts applications.
Unable to enable or disable %s while in Guest mode.
Do you want to restart your phone to turn off Safe Mode? All of your apps will be restored.
Tap to turn off Safe Mode.

"Your phone is getting too hot, so it's taking steps to cool itself down.
You can still use your phone, but you may notice: The screen might dim. The phone might slow down. Charging might pause.
After the phone cools down, performance will automatically go back to normal."

"Your tablet is getting too hot, so it’s taking steps to cool itself down.
You can still use your tablet, but you may notice: The screen might dim. The tablet might slow down. Charging might pause.
After the tablet cools down, performance will Automatically go back to normal."
When tethering is enabled, all packet transmission is regarded as communications made by connecting to a PC or other external device.
In this case, Packet communication charges may apply even when external devices are not connected. To avoid additional costs, disabling tethering is strongly recommended when finished.
Press and hold the recent key to view the menu.
The menu key has been replaced by the recent key to allow you to quickly change between the applications you used most recently. Tap Help for more information.
